intro: Galium tolosianum, commonly known as Tolosan bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically oval to lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Galium tolosianum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
